sentence.Network_en: The Australian wallaby resembles a hare and has persistent teeth.

when the first Europeans reached Tasmania , they found natives whose only shields against the winter chill were seal-fat smeared on their skin and wallaby pelts over their shoulders .当第一批欧洲人到达塔斯马尼亚岛的时候，他们发现，当地人仅仅依靠往皮肤上涂抹海豹油脂和肩披沙袋鼠毛皮，来抵御冬天的严寒。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from Dharuk walabi or waliba

entry.tran: 沙袋鼠(产于澳大利亚和新几内亚)
entry.def: A wallaby is an animal similar to a small kangaroo. Wallabies live in Australia and New Guinea.

means.word_mean: 1. any of various small or medium-sized kangaroos often brightly colored
